Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Response:
Script: i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for wednesday, december 4th. meta is gearing up for a significant layout shift as it prepares to launch its new virtual reality workspace app, dubbed horizon workrooms. this move is part of meta's broader push to make the metaverse a central aspect of its business strategy, with the release coming as the company seeks to rebound from its recent dip in vr hardware sales. meanwhile, amazon is reportedly scaling up its efforts in autonomous delivery by expanding its fleet of electric delivery vans. the e-commerce giant plans to test these autonomous vehicles in multiple urban areas, aiming to reduce its carbon footprint while improving last-mile delivery efficiency. over in the semiconductor scene, nvidia posted stellar third-quarter earnings, driven by strong demand for its ai-focused gpus. the company's ceo, jensen huang, emphasized that ai technology would continue to be the company's growth cornerstone as industries increasingly adopt ai tools to optimize operations. and finally, google faces new antitrust scrutiny in the european union over its advertising practices, with regulators investigating claims that google favors its own services over competitors. this examination marks another chapter in ongoing tensions between tech giants and european regulators. that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for wednesday, december 4th. meta is preparing for a major shift with the launch of its new virtual reality workspace app called horizon workrooms. this initiative is part of meta's broader strategy to embed the metaverse at the core of its business, especially as it looks to recover from a recent decline in vr hardware sales. over at amazon, the e-commerce titan is ramping up its commitment to autonomous delivery, expanding its fleet of electric delivery vans. these vehicles will be tested across several urban areas with the dual aim of cutting down on carbon emissions and boosting last-mile delivery efficiency. 

in the semiconductor sector, nvidia has reported impressive third-quarter earnings, fueled by a surge in demand for its ai-focused gpus. ceo jensen huang underlined that ai technology remains a pivotal growth driver for nvidia, emphasizing its increasing adoption across industries aiming to enhance operational efficiency. 

meanwhile, google finds itself under the microscope again as the european union deepens its antitrust investigation into the tech giant's advertising practices. regulators are examining allegations that google may be favoring its own services over competitors, signaling continued friction between tech behemoths and european authorities. 

that's all for today's update. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-165 Meta's Metaverse Move 🌐, Amazon's Autonomous Ambitions 🚚, Nvidia's Ai Surge 🚀
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for wednesday, december 4th! here are today's top tech stories:

  • meta's metaverse move: meta unveils horizon workrooms, a virtual reality workspace app aiming to embed the metaverse at its core, amid a recovery strategy from declining vr hardware sales.
  • amazon's autonomous fleet expansion: amazon expands its electric delivery vans across urban areas to reduce carbon emissions and improve last-mile delivery efficiency.
  • nvidia's strong earnings: fueled by high demand for ai-driven gpus, nvidia reports impressive q3 earnings, with ceo jensen huang highlighting ai's role as a key growth driver.
  • google under eu scrutiny: the european union deepens its antitrust investigation into google's advertising practices amid allegations of favoring its own services over competitors.

stay tuned for tomorrow's tech updates!
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image set in a futuristic, digital metropolis that is both grounded and ethereal. the scene is an expansive virtual cityscape, symbolizing meta's metaverse, with shimmering, iridescent skyscrapers blending seamlessly with a starry, galactic sky, suggesting limitless exploration and connectivity. in the foreground, an advanced, sleek self-driving truck navigates a bustling futuristic highway, representing amazon's autonomous ambitions, with luminescent trails indicating its dynamic, efficient routes. above, a massive, pulsating neural network in the shape of a dragon soars through the sky, signifying nvidia's ai surge, with electrifying energy streams branching across the image. the elements are interwoven, creating an all-encompassing vision of a highly interconnected and transformative technological future
